author: Ulkar Alakbarova
text: My sale was cancelled, while the item was on the way to VC. I have sent the item outside of Europe therefore it took more time to be delivered. Through the tracking number I have send via chat twice to their representative. Each time they said “no worries” we made note of that. In fact they didn’t care to make notes and make sure it doesn’t get cancelled. I have asked how to write complain, they have answered via us we will transfer to logistic team. Very disappointed with such service!
title: Terrible customer service

author: Jet
text: What the hell happened? Vestiaire Collective used to be legit and I used to be able make purchases and sell items on their site with confidence. My last transaction with them though has been a NIGHTMARE. I bought a bag on 2/5 and was charged for it and I haven’t gotten any update since. On their website, it says they have received the item and accepted it but that was 3 weeks ago. I have reached out to them multiple times to ask about the status of my order, and have gotten the standard “we’ll investigate and get back to you in 72hrs” but after 72 hrs, NADA! I’m currently in the process in disputing the charge with my bank but what a NIGHTMARE! Never again!
title: What the hell happened

author: Emma
text:
Shipping labels never work
Have sold quite a few items now and am pleased with that (obviously). the problem is that the shipping system is not seamless. the waybill numbers that they provide me with never work and for every sale i have to go through the online chat to rectify this. Quite a flaw in their business model. i have asked for this to be raised higher up the chain of command but nothing is ever done. their customer service is very poor - woudl be much easier if you could speak to someone. 
Also, their new payment system has been slower for me - i am still awaiting payment for a sale 3 weeks ago. 
Great business idea, poor execution.
title: Shipping labels never work

author: Pj
text: The worst company I have ever shopped with. They are sneaky and unreliable. They do not care for customer service, when issues arise you can only deal with bots and not humans. I would never ever ever use this company - they should be ashamed of themselves and how much hassle they cause for their shoppers. I have had 4 items never actually end up being delivered to me and am yet to receive any human contact. Avoid at all cost!!!!!
title: The worst company I have ever shopped…

author: KHK
text: If I could give them zero it would be zero. Absolutely useless. No phone number to call, live chat is a robot and nobody replies to inquiry about an item which can't be shipped by chronopost. Chronopost just told me they can't ship due to logistics problems and I don't even speak French. Nobody at Vestiaire has even bothered to reply. Also no email to contact them. Why do they use chronopost from Europe to Asia, just stick to DHL. Will be lodging a PayPal claim for non delivery. Buyer beware.
title: If I could give them zero it would be…

author: Elaine O'Connell
text: Let me start by saying that as a buyer I’ve had only good experiences, as a seller, however, it’s absolutely shocking. I sold a bag early February, the buyer received it on the 16th and my payment still hasn’t been transferred. This new “get paid” feature doesn’t appear to be functioning properly as it doesn’t capture the information I submit. I’ve sent dozens of emails, spent hours on live chats and nobody has solved my problem. They are flat out ignoring me now; and I don’t have any idea if I will ever get paid the 770 euro owed to me:(
title: Sellers steer clear

author: Sarah Hicks
text: Purchased two items from Vestiaire and both items had significant issues despite going through “authentication and quality control” by so called “experts”. One was the wrong colour and the other missing a strap. VC and I could not come to a mutually agreeable solution to the second issue. I have decided to take my business elsewhere. The promise of VC is that their items are quality controlled but this did not match my experience. I have had a much easier time dealing with trusted resellers on eBay and will not continue to shop with VC.
title: Quality control and issue resolution lacking

author: Anna
text:
Had one of my items refused for a reason I really can't figure out. Having had many irritating listing experiences by VC, I decided to ask their chat advisors the reason why. The weirdest answer ever: 
(05:39:37)	me: this item refused.
(05:39:51)	me: I am wondering why
(05:40:07)	VC: Let me check its history.
(05:40:45)	me: thanks
(05:44:52)	VC: Thanks for waiting.
(05:46:43)	me: go on.
(05:47:15)	VC: From the records the decision of refusal was such that the photo does not allow VC properly control your part and does not meet the criteria.
(05:48:01)	VC: Therefore, we invite you to renew your deposit by selecting photos that highlight your item and provide buyers with maximum details.
(05:48:28)	me: properly control my part?
(05:48:44)	me: I sent at least 10 pictures
(05:49:00)	me: is that not enough for vc to "control"?
(05:51:05)	me: I would be happy if curation team to check one more time
(05:51:55)	VC: It is the curation's call which they have an algorithm and criteria for allowing or refusing an item.
(05:52:07)	me: because prefer this item sells on other platform , so I don't need to waste any more time being refused by vc

I listed a men's denim jacket with a detachable wool shawl. It's authentic. It's by a hip Japanese street brand. There were at least 10-12 photos submitted, all taken in broad daylight, up close and personal AF. 
You cannot possibly convince me you cannot work with 10-12 pictures for a jacket! What exactly does VC need to 'control' ? And what sort of algorithm does a denim jacket need to pass? I've had items refused before from other platforms and the reasons were REALLY REALLY CLEAR eg. INCLUDE THE OTHER PAGE OF THE WASHING LABEL <-- that's what I consider clear instructions, I'm not here to crack programming riddles and waste time posting items that can rejected with vague, cryptic 'reasons'! Sort yourselves out!
title: Giving another bad review

author: Louisa Vincini
text: Ordered a coat 5 weeks ago. Literally been in conversations with customer service every few days - totally useless.Tracking not updated for weeks at a time. Filed for lost item a week ago - not heard a word. Customer service say they will chase it up - its been at the UK depot now 4 weeks - literally a joke. Coat was a gift and obviously the birthday has been and gone - had to find an alternative. A coat won't be needed by the time it arrives. Definitely would not order from them again - and wouldn't have ordered in the first place if I'd have known I would need to wait so long.
title: Ordered 5 weeks ago and still no delivery

author: leon wang
text:
The quality control team cannot read English even though they sell in Australia. I have a listing that stated in CAPITAL LETTERS NOTE THERES A STAIN. 

Yet the quality control team were too lazy to read my description and deem that I didn’t list it. There’s no way to contact the team to address this issue. The buyer already bought the item knowing about the defect since it’s listed in the description with capital letters and a lot of pictures of the defect.

This is just laziness, they’re getting $400 from this Chanel piece yet they cannot spend 10 sec to read the product description from the seller. 

This is pure laziness and someone in the company trying their best to deny any profitability. The item is in Hong Kong, most likely due to some Hong Kong vs Australia issue.

Please do not list any second hand item on this site as they will try to reduce price without reading description during quality control. Why bother opening a second hand resell service if the quality control cannot read description about defects and stains or look at images of the listing.
title: The quality control team cannot read…
